intro: Sisyrinchium breviarmium, commonly known as the short-stem blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, grass-like appearance with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright blue or violet flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Sisyrinchium breviarmium is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
